francesca h
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: at first I wasn't very happy for having chosen this hotel. However I must say that the bed is very comfortable and position is very nice. Access to transportation is good. Furniture is old and the elevator is even older.

This property is close than ginza avenue and subway station. Many people walking between good stores and restaurants. So easy for who have a few time to enjoy Tokyo.The breakfast have been served a good options of differents kinds of food and doesn´t included in the room fee.

Hotel Monterey Ginza was good. Location is convenient to train station and we also managed to go to Tsukiji fish market. The hotel was a bit outdated but the stay was comfortable. Staff were great. We did a lot of walking to do shopping near the train station. Generally it was good value for money staying there.

As per title the location is superb for local shopping and subways are no problem for walking either. Hotel is ok but was weak in certain aspects by Japanese standards. First instance reception experience was average which surprised me (twice). Beds way too hard for me, which is normal by the way, I'm just preparing the unwary. The room is small which is again normal but I made the error of not checking in advance as I had 5 days in a box, which is too much for us we now know. So consider yourself informed. Overall thought it was ok but cost was high for what we had and not as good as the one I'm sitting in now, so standards could be better. Cheers enjoy.

This is the second time we stayed at this hotel. We love it as it close to train station and also close to Ginza shopping area. In front of the hotel we can easily find supermarket and restaurant to eat.We were surprised when we arrived in the room, all our luggages that we deposited initially at the lobby were already inside our room.The room is ok for Japanese standard, great in room wifi, and we love the Shiseido shampoo, conditioner and soap! Great bed and pillow too, although it is not Japanese standards.Check out time is standard Japanese hotel at 11 am.The hotel also sells daily unlimited train ticket at ¥800 which is very valuable when you plan to explore around Tokyo.The only thing that we were not happy was when they do not allow us to store our luggages when we were going to other cities and plan to pick them up when we return to Tokyo.

Hotel Monterey Ginza is quite a good location quite convenient coming from Haneda airport, you need to take the Toei Asakusa line then alight at Higashi Ginza exit a1 with an elevator access upon you exit take the cross road then walk strAight about two blocks then turn left and right and you will see the hotel. Location wise is good a few minutes to the Ginza shopping district. The hotel itself is near major convenience stores.

In the heart of Ginza it is as spacious as they come in Tokyo, situated an easy stroll to Ginza or Yarakucho station as well as Tsukuji fish market it is well located.Very affordable considering the area that it is in and it is a very well kept hotel with outstanding service will definitely return.

A nice mid-size Hotel that is no more than 100m from Ginza, train station is close and for the price it's a great night stay. Take note the rooms ain't big but this is central Tokyo. Lots of eateries, drug stores and convenient stores surround the place. Room is clean and well kept. Wi-fi is excellent and service is very friendly. When we next come back, this will be our place to stay in Tokyo.

This hotel is as central as it gets. Right in the Ginza, close to train station. It is also very cheap considering the location. The staff was also accommodation. We complained about the room being to warm and the air conditioning did not turn on, they found us another room on another floor with an open window.

The hotel is much better than I expected. It's a 10 mins walk to Ginza station and within walking distance to fish market. We took airport shuttle bus and walked to the hotel. And it's also okay to walk to Tokyo Station if you need to take bullet train.The room is kind of spacious in Tokyo's standard, big enough to include a tea table besides a queen bed, a writing desk and tv desk. Bathroom is small but efficiently designed, equipped with nice toiletries including hair clips, bath sponge. What else you can expect for less than SGD200 a night!

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and we found a good place. It is very convenient to transportation, the staff was helpful and the breakfast was very good. The room was a little small but for two of us it was ok. One disappointment was that we lost one of those credit card - type keys and the hotel charged us 1000 yen. That's a steep price for a piece of plastic!

This hotel is located in Ginza and reasonably priced.I did late check in so even though I booked single room, they gave me twin room.Room was surprisingly big, compared to other tokyo hotels.Room was clean and had everything I needed to stay for a night.Staff were nice but i often see line up at front desk.Unfortunately there was no airport shuttle bus stop at this hotel which i usually do other tokyo hotels. So either you have to go another hotel to take shuttle bus or go Tokyo station to get one.Overall I had good stay and I would recommend this hotel to my friend.

It's a lovely hotelThe rooms were considerably smaller than we were use to something we came to expect on our Japan adventure as were the hard beds.The rooms were clean and well cared for. The location was as I hoped It was a more expensive area but it was chosen for location. our daughter and her partner found some lovely bars near byThe staff were friendly and helpful, we requested a luggage transfer to Osaka and it was handled efficiently We were lucky that the clerk had a little more understanding of Englishit made the request easierEnjoyed our stay in Ginza

I want to stay at this hotel in my future visit ini Tokyo. Its location is easyly reached from the JR station. Surrounded by mini market like lawson, seven eleven, so we can buy beverages, or even foods there. The surface of the room is enough for our big valise and our shopping bags. They provide also the kettle/water boiler and the fridge in the room. Thanx to the very warming staffs, we can get all the information about the routes, the JR station, and Shinkansen. Ginza is the place for shoppig, just 5 minutes of walking, you can get the shopping area. Prepare you big bagage.

The hotel is located very nicely in Ginza, with many good restaurants nearby. It is close to two subway stations with easy access to the rest of Tokyo. Tsuskiji is also within walking distance. The rooms are quite big, when you compare them to the small rooms in many Tokyo hotels. Staff is friendly and everything is very clean. I can definately recommend this hotel.

Stayed for a couple nights before heading north. Great location for good shopping. Good izakaya and restaurants scattered around. Convenience store across the street was super helpful. Room was small, as normal in Japan, but very clean. Courteous and helpful staff. Recommended.

Good location, but small room which good to fit with friends' visit. Easy access to Ginza downtown in a few minutes. Good stay when you purpose to do shopping mainly in Ginza. Check sometimes it has a great deal to stay!

Great location ten minutes walk from Tokyo's main train station. Easy walk to shopping, restaurants and entertainment. Very boutique feel with very friendly staff and a tremendous breakfast, both Japanese and Western. Decent room size for Japan. Would definitely return.

The location of this hotel is perfect in Ginza. The rooms are clean and bathroom was also big. The only problem is no room service and Laundry. The breakfast was also good with good variety. It's perfect place to stay in Ginza

We returned to the Monterey Ginza after two years. It combines a rather traditional feel with a very zippy location: restaurants nearby, and just round the corner from Ginza shops and the Ginza station whose subway trains seem to go everywhere (you need exit A13 to find the hotel again; subway passes are sold at the hotel). The rooms are not large and of course, Japanese style, lack cupboards or shelving, but there is a minibar, and excellent breakfasts of western and Japanese options, with some serious minded dining room staff. We were happy to return.

We arrived and were able to find this hotel within 10 minutes of arriving off of the train. Centrally located in Ginza, 8 minute walk to the tsukiji market, 3 minutes from the main strip of Ginza strip.Our room was on the top floor, the hall way to our hotel room was a little warm. Once we opened our room the room was clean! Cold! And bigger then I expected.Not only that, the amenities and bathroom were new! The bathroom had enough space. Comparing this to our Kyoto hotel where we are cramped and the bathroom needs to be updated.Also, the towels were soft a huge plus for me and the bed was hard, which I needed after a long flight.Also the hotel staff speak several languages to accommodate, and have an intercity train special for 1-3 days. Highly recommended picking up if you are visiting Tokyo!!!1500 yen for 3 days per person! This is a steal for unlimited rides!Wish I was staying again here with the location, amenities, and wonderful staff!

We booked this hotel on the basis of both the most recent reviews and a price point [40 % off for an advanced booking] and had booked for the first 2 days and last 4 days of our 2-week holiday in Japan. Shutterbug07 gave an extremely comprehensive review of the position and sizing of the rooms. All that I wish to add is that we found the hotel quite bleak. Yes, the position was excellent and for Japanese hotel rooms a reasonable size but the rooms were quite dark and bland. There were no decorations or anything to increase the attractiveness of the room. I'm not sure what the flooring was - linoleum perhaps but it gave the room a very 'clinical' feel. My biggest criticism was that the corridor up to our room was constantly filled with all the cleaning products and utensils and worse, all the dirty bags of laundry collected from nearby rooms. These piles remained there for a greater part of the day - it was very off-putting. I have never encountered this at any of the hotels we have stayed in - particularly through Japan. It gave a somewhat 'unclean' aura. Also the lifts were in a state of disrepair with unfinished walls. The reception area is small and what would be called a lobby area was particularly uninviting and not the cleanest. Staff were efficient for both check-in and -out but for the rest unengaged and disinterested. Needless to say we cancelled our scheduled second stay for the last leg of our trip in this hotel and booked another hotel in Tokyo.In summary, if position and price are all that you require, this hotel is fair. If you require anything more from your stay we would recommend more research.

The greatest thing about this hotel is its location. Literally 30 seconds to the subway station, right in the centre of ginza. The room is like budget hotel. Very basic. Bathroom is tiny, also very basic. If you are first time in Tokyo, you don't have to stay here, as long as you are on subway line. You can get a much nicer hotel with the same price.

First time in Japan & Tokyo for myself, Husband and his parents. We chose this hotel based off Trip Advisor reviews and it was perfect! Amazing location - safe, easy to get anywhere via train or taxi, classy area, a TON of food options right around the corner and literally FIVE convenience stores across the street/around the corner for quick snacks and drinks. The Staff is so friendly and beyond accommodating. They speak wonderful English (I appreciate anyone that can help us get by...even when they don't think their English is good...it is!), and they are just wonderful and welcoming. The rooms are small (like most Japanese rooms) but plenty big enough and very comfortable...and most importantly...SPOTLESS! We love everything about this hotel and recommend it 100%! It's perfect for any type of vacation in Tokyo!!

I think it was a worthwhile stay at this property. There are different choices of the subway within 3 to 10 minutes walk. The twin room I stayed in was clean although a little small even though my mom and I are "regular-sized" Asians. Otherwise, the room is really comfortable.I loved how it's just next to the Ginza shopping strip. And I could get to Tsukiji Market on foot within 30 minutes!

I've been to Tokyo many times.the Hotel Monterey Ginza building always appealed to me due to its appearance and ultraclose position to the main shopping street Ginza chuo doreBeautiful well kept Art Deco ish .The reception area is 1950's well maintained and preserved charm just so cool.The reception staff are courteous and helpful and English friendly.Our room was ready and for the very reasonable amount of 1000 yen about $14 a day and we were offered an upgrade to a bigger room.The room was excellent , great big comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom great amenities in the bathroom, quiet clean, lots room for all our cases an armchair .CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN.A NICE touch a pair of cotton pyjamas provided daily in your size Very niceThe room was serviced perfectly daily and in a timely manner.I recommend that you stay at H MONTEREY GINZA and enjoy the city

Me and my friend stayed here for 4 nights during our trip to Tokyo. It's a nice hotel, located in the heart of Ginza. It's very close to the subway station and as a result it is very well connected to other areas/sights in Tokyo. The rooms are average sized, pleasant and very clean. The hotel staff are helpful and kind. Overall, we would both recommend this hotel as a good base for exploring Tokyo.

From February 26 to March 2, 2016, my family and I were on holiday in Tokyo and had the opportunity to stay at Hotel Monterey Ginza.Hotel Monterey Ginza may be categorized as a business hotel and very nicely located near Ginza's main shopping avenue (Chuo Dori). It's around an 8-10min walk if I remember correctly. It's tucked away in a quiet sidestreet, yet it's very accessible as there are train stations a few hundred feet away (Ginza Station, Ginza-Itchome Station, etc.). We just had trouble upon our arrival from Narita airport because we just took the airport limousine bus and got dropped off at a designated Ginza station. It could be quite difficult to find the hotel on foot if you don't know its exact location. But after that, we didn't have much trouble anymore. Across the street from the hotel, there is a Family Mart; and a Tomod's pharmacy and convenience store is just a corner away. That was great because that's where we bought our bottled water and snacks. There are a few small restaurants nearby, as well. There are a few high-end stores around, too (Tiffany & Co., Itoya, etc.). As mentioned, the main shopping avenue is just an 8-10min walk away. Stores such as Prada, Bulgari, Uniqlo, etc. could be found there. There are also Department Stores such as Matsuya Ginza. Of course, there are a number of higher-end restaurants to try, too. It's a great location, I don't think anyone will get bored staying there. We also just walked going to the Imperial Palace grounds. It's a bit of an effort on foot (around 2km), but there are so many things to see on the way there so you won't really notice the distance.The hotel itself is quaint. The decor is more trendy than modern, with a bit of a hipster vibe. The lobby is quite small, but it wasn't crowded when we went so it wasn't a problem. Also, the reception staff was efficient so whenever there was a line, turnover was quite quick. They also have a parking area in the building, although we didn't have a car so we didn't get to try it. They also have a restaurant, but we didn't get to try that, too, so I can't comment on the food. The area around the hotel was very clean.My friend and I stayed in a standard Double room, while my parents lucked out and were assigned a Double room, but a corner one (we booked through Booking.com). Our room was good enough for us. There was enough room for our luggage (1 luggage each), and there was a small cabinet where we could hang our jackets. The bed was big enough for the both of us to fit comfortably. They provided bedroom slippers, as well as pajamas. We liked that very much. There was a small desk, one sofa chair, and one desk chair. There wasn't much room to move / lounge around, we were more or less limited to lounging on the bed, but the room was just a place to sleep anyway so we were fine. The size of the bathroom was okay, too. They had a high-tech toilet (with heater, bidet, etc.), a sink, and a tub with a shower. They also had enough racks to hold our towels and clothes. There were toiletries provided, water pressure was strong, and hot water was readily available. There was ample lighting, an electric kettle, small refrigerator, cups and glasses, and a humidifier. There was also a flat-screen tv, but only had mostly local Japanese channels. My parents' room was pretty much the same, except they had a little more space since they had a corner room. Both had views of the street outside (no building blocking the natural light).We didn't need much customer service from them, but during our limited interaction with them, their staff was polite and approachable.Some comments:1. The central airconditioner / heater could get too warm at night. We didn't know how to adjust the temperature to make the room cooler. We just adjusted and resorted to either not using the comforter blanket, or turning on the humidifier to have some cold air circulating. It didn't bother us too much, though, because we were always so tired when we got back to the hotel that falling asleep right away wasn't too difficult.2. Please consider adding more English channels to the TV channel line-up. The only English channel was a news channel (NHK World, I think) with the featured shows replaying over and over. Although it was actually quite entertaining to watch Japanese shows, the language barrier could get a bit suffocating after a while. English channels similar to those in Hongkong hotels would do -- National Geographic, Discovery Channel, and any English movie channel.Overall, we enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It was comfortable, and good place to come home to after a day of exploring. It's smaller than we're used to; however, I do believe it's bigger than a lot of other Japanese hotel rooms. Plus, the location was really great.

This is a lovely little boutique hotel in a great location right in Ginza. The room was quite small but perfectly fine for one person. The room was clean and quiet and had excellent wifi. The hotel staff were very helpful. Probably more suited to business travelers than families. Enjoyed the hotel breakfast.

The hotel is not modern with facilities as gym or pool, but the location is great, in the heart of Ginza, with several options in terms of tube stops and walking distance from some attractions as fish market and imperial palace and central station.

Good standard of hotel, well located for sightseeing. The rooms are typically small, which would have been for fine for two of us... but we had our teenage daughter in the room too, which made it a real squeeze.

I was happy with this choice in Ginza, as it was in the exact location I wanted, and the building and general ambiance were a cut above the standard business hotel. Great outlook from the high floors, obliging, relatively friendly staff and quiet (despite being heavily booked, and hosting seemingly continuous weddings). This said, our triple room was tiny. Too small for us and all our luggage at the beginning of a three week Japanese tour. I sort of expected this given the reasonable price, so I'm not really complaining. Bathroom was good, and the public areas had a good feel except there was no lobby lounge to speak of. Lots of character in the decor, and felt Japanese rather than generic. It's hard to know the best area to stay in Tokyo but Ginza is good for world brand as well as boutique Japanese shopping, restaurants, lovely little lanes and of course ease of getting to other places. It's not something to agonise over as transport is so easy you can get to most places of interest quickly.

This hotel in Ginza has a very good location. Very near to the main shopping area 3 small blocks. Close to 2 main stations Ginza, yurakucho . Recomended hotel for 2 asian size people. Double bed is 140cm width. Room is small small small but for couple is good enough. But if ur not a couple get ready to become one. At night there is a local ramen restaurant . Very good. Hope this help

Lovely hotel in the Ginza close to several subway stations, restaurants, shops and sight-seeing (Tsukiji is just a 10 minute walk).Don't be put off by the lobby which is a little decrepit. The rooms are larger than most in Tokyo for the same price and have all the amenities you will need: WiFi, TV (with English language channels), fridge, air-conditioning etc. The bathrooms were decent-sized (with nice toiletries) and the beds comfortable.Service was wonderful. The front desk speaks very competent English (not a given even in Tokyo). One night we wanted a window opened at 10 pm. We asked the front desk and someone was at our door within minutes.The hotel has a restaurant which looked nice but we didn't get to try. There is a great Starbucks for breakfast (if you just want something light) within two blocks and it opens at 7am (some of them don't open till 8 or later). There are also some other coffee places in the neighborhood.We would definitely stay here if we came back to Tokyo.

The hotel was pretty nice, but the service was subpar and the rooms were very small (barely anywhere to talk walk in the room and had to pay extra for 2 twin beds). Location was excellent though--right in the heart of Ginza and easy access to metro.

location is A+, walking distant from Tokyo central (10 mins) and to many major attractions, breakfast is A+, but I suggest just walk down to Tsukiji Fish Market (about 10 mins), rooms on the small side but its got everything, and everything works.

The Monterey Hotel is in a very convenient location in Ginza.The rooms are well decorated, the bedding is comfortable and the bathrooms are a decent size. All of the staff were extremely polite and helpful. We didn't eat in the hotel but there are plenty of great places to eat close by. There is a really good ramen noodle place down one of the side streets opposite the hotel, and there is a Family Mart opposite if you need one.It is a 5 minute walk to Toyko station (Maranuchi end) and a taxi will cost approx 700yen from the station.We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

From the exterior, the hotel looked very promising. Its in a good (if rather expensive) part of town but the area is very nice. There is good shopping nearby and there are some good restaurants too.The lobby looks like it was last decorated in the 1930s. It needs a serious upgrade. Its dour and miserable and too small to sit in.Hotel reception staff, however , were extremely helpful and I congratulate them on the high level of service which they offered. This was in stark contrast to those who organised breakfast. First, you have to present your ticket to someone akin to an army major. Lord help you if you forget your breakfast ticket or walk uninvited into the dining room! On the first morning, I had to queue for breakfast for nearly thirty minutes. Eventually, I was seated and accessed the rather limited variety of food on offer. Another morning, the bacon ran out and that entailed a fifteen minute wait. If you are lucky, you might be seated in the main dining area. On the other hand, you might be seated in a dismal room further away . Should this happen, you have to get your food on a tray and walk out of the main area.The room was disappointingly small but it was clean with all facilities in working order. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet. Mine was a no-smoking room but the corridor did smell of smoke on two or three occasions - a real "turn off" for me.The hotel certainly has potential but needs a manager who will drag it into the twenty first century. Queuing for food with a tray like people in a prison is not my idea of a good hotel.

Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I loved the classic atmosphere of this hotel: not the usual business like sense of urgency, but a feeling of calm and serenity - yet in the hearth of Ginza - very convenient to transportation, shopping and dining.A really great experience.

Tucked away in the side street of Ginza, very convenient to go pretty much anywhere around there, and it's quiet in the evenings. Plenty of convenience stores within reach. Booked a small double room but took the option to upgrade to a double bed room (with a supplement) which was a good choice as it was more spacious - exactly what the front desk staff told me. While you may notice the chips in the paint and furniture, it was very clean and comfortable. Good bathroom & amenities. The whole place is very 'retro' and I loved it, especially the elevator. Helpful staff.

Spent 5 nights here early April 2016. As others have stated, it's in a great location and near all the metro stops. It's walk-able from Tokyo station, but not really with all your luggage the first night. A cab cost us 900 yen which was easily worth it and took less than 10 minutes.Initially we had a double room which was far too small, so after the first night we upgraded to the next size for 4000 yen a night. This was fine, and also on a higher floor.We didn't use the restaurant but it looked nice. We found the staff to be most helpful too. I accidentally left a credit card in our room and they mailed it on to our Kyoto hotel (charged for it though).So, to summarize, hotels in Tokyo are expensive, especially those in good areas like this one. The Monterey Ginza represented very good value for money and ticked all the boxes for us. Would definitely stay again

Perfect position for our traipsing around Tokyo - this hotel was efficient, clean and the staff were courteous. We'd been warned off the breakfast because it was apparently very costly for what you got. So we headed out each (rainy) morning in search of a wonderful breakfast where the value was better. We had a fair few disasters on that score until we found one near the Ginza station that was lovely. HOWEVER, on our last day in Tokyo, we decided to try the hotel breakfast for speed and ease – it was actually very nice! I don't know why all the negative comments. There was a wide range of both Japanese and European fare and we had a marvellous breakfast and it was not that expensive compared with other places. So, moral of the story - don't always take other people's word for things. Try it yourself and make your own mind up.

The Hotel Monterey Ginza is a relatively good choice for anyone looking to stay in Ginza. Its location is probably its greatest strength, even though it is a fairly long walk from the metro station.As to the rooms, they are definitely small but not tiny either. At least you can stay there with young kids and this is why I picked this place.The staff was kind but probably not as warm as that of Hotel Monterey Kyoto where I also happened to stay during the same trip. All in all I recommend - probably not warmly though - but this hotel is a good choice for those on a shopping tour!

Had one night in Tokyo after arriving from a cruise. The hotel is right in the centre of Ginza and idea for shopping or getting around on the subway.The reception area is tired and old and needs redecoration but the rooms were clean and comfortable although there was only a shower over the bath and this caused problems for one friend who is unable to get into the bath.The restaurant is old fashioned but has lovely chandeliers and with some redecoration could be beautiful.

- Good Ginza location.- A one minute walk to the main street (they close it for pedestrians on Sundays from AM to PM)- Family Mart and a few other convenience stores are all across the street.- Rooms are small but they are nicely decorated- Better to spend a little bit more for an executive room -Fancy restaurants and chic stores are a stone throw away.

Travelling as a family of four in Tokyo is tricky and meant that we needed to book two rooms when staying in western hotels in Japan. The Hotel Monterey gave us two adjoining rooms with an interconnecting door that could be locked open. Contrary to other review, it was more spacious than I expected. It certainly wasn't huge, but the bathroom was a good size and there was plenty of room for us to place our luggage.The staff were helpful, the breakfasts set us up perfectly for hardcore sightseeing and we absolutely loved being so close to the beautiful wide, clean streets of Ginza.

This is an old fashioned hotel but it has a certain charm about it. The staff are very kind and helpful and the hotel is clean. We booked through Expedia months in advance and contacted the hotel to ask for a twin room (usually bigger than doubles in Japan), on a high floor and in the corner, which is classed as an upgrade from the room we would have got. We were given a room as requested on the 12th floor (there are 13) and paid the extra for the upgrade on check out. It was well worth having space and decent view with a couple of lovely sunrises to wake up to.The location is excellent, Ginza is a very nice area and the hotel is very close to all the shops. There is a family mart grocery store opposite for any bits to grab and entrance to the metro is nearby.If you are collecting your JR pass from Haneda airport jump straight on the monorail using the pass and change at hamamatsucho for JR Yamanote line and then get off at Yurakucho. We then walked 10 - 15 mins to hotel and so didn't cost anything using JR pass. Or instead of walking you can take the Yurakucho subway line to Ginza-Itchome which will get you very close to hotel.

Very nice location from everything u need in Ginza/ tokyo! The subway station is closed!!! You could take a walk to either department store/ shopping street/ tokyo station.... Really just everything you neeed it tokyo is right there. Taking subway to other area is pretty easy!!! I do enjoy my stay!!!

We stayed at the Hotel Monterey Ginza. It's in a GREAT location, near all the metro stops. We were able to easily hop on to the metro. The hotel is also near the fish market. The property is nice. Though the room is small, but it was fine with us. The staff is very friendly. Ask for a map at the front desk to get you around. It drizzled one day while we were there. The hotel offered an umbrella for us to use. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Tokyo.

Good location in Ginza, rooms (at least the twin bedded) are "OK" and the bathroom is good. Staff friendly. Breakfast "fair", buffet items mostly cold,no enough staff to follow up and surprise for Japan, stools and table cloths dirty, more "mainland China style" some years ago...Compared to what they offer and the price of better hotels, not really the best deal.Say it is a noble hotel for well situated backpackers

Tokyo is not cheap for hotels, especially in mid-city neigborhoods and Hotel Monterey Ginza was relatively cheap so I really didn't expect much. In fact, being 6 foot 2 inches I expected the room would be pretty cramped.In reality this was a very good value. The room was reasonably sized (not huge, but enough space for a few days), the bathroom was nice enough, the beds fairly comfortable and the service helpful and friendly. The neighborhood of Ginza is more for business people during the day, but there are a lot of business bars open after dark, even if tourists aren't always totally welcomed. But the location is close to Tokyo station and a couple of metro lines that allow you to get most places in central tokyo within about 30 mins or so. If you get out at Ginza station, exit A13 is the closest to HMG.I would stay here again.

Hotel was located in a very convenient location. The room was large enough for my husband and I to move about and store our luggage. Lots of stores and restaurants you can walk to---there is also a Natural Lawson store just across the street a couple minutes from the hotel. The breakfast buffet was good but did not change at all from day to day--we stayed for four nights. The staff provided excellent service.

I arrived here with a tour group. The place was nice. Rustic. Though the rooms were quite modern. Their staff were courteous and friendly. The amenities were complete. The hotel is situated practically just 2 blocks away from Ginza. My only gripe was the elevator. There was a time when our tour group got delayed due to an elevator malfunction. Considering some of them were senior citizens, you can't expect them to come rushing down the stairs.

The toilet was not properly cleaned when we arrived, the bed was not great. The room looks old. There are better options in tokyo for this price tagOn the positive side the hotel is near the tokyo station and thr toilet have a good amenities (toothbrush, hairbrush, ...)

Perfect location at reasonable price  Walking distance to many culinary heights of Tokyo. Tsukiji Fish Market and with that two top Sushi places Sushi Dai & Daiwa Sushi = 10-15 min walk. Hidemi Sugino = 10 – 15 min walk. Henri Charpentier = 2 min walk, same street, same side. 2 of the best patisseries in Tokyo. And many more. If u r into shopping, u have all major brands there to satiate ur desires. Compact rooms, Japanese style. Helpful staff at the frontdesk. Not all but some of the staff members speak acceptable level of English and the information u get from them, is reliable in most of the cases.

My husband and I stayed March 14-18,2016 in Hotel Monterey Ginza and our hotel experience made our Tokyo trip a memorable one.DIRECT HOTEL BOOKING:I am not a great fan of hotel booking websites, so we made advance booking resv a month before DIRECTLY with the hotel Reservations,enabling us to have a personal email communication with a good English speaking staff,who patiently answered all our queries and concerns for our stay.COMFY ROOMS:We got a good advanced booking price for a Twin Room(19sq),very good size for two people travelling w/2 big luggage,having 2double beds and a foyer entrance space(check out hotel fotos of twin room in hotel website).Bathroom was a good size one,with a no-fogging mirror and the typical 'full service' water toilet!Although Japan hotel rooms are known to be relatively small,we definitely still had good ample space to move around.Our request for a quiet, non smoking floor on high floor(12/f) was granted.WiFi service was great and we managed to survive on 2 English TV channels...LOCATION FOR VALUE OF MONEY:Great location!Tge cold but pleasantvspribg weatger enabled us to walk leisurely around the nearby areas! Hotel is within walking distance of the Subway station exits(Ginza Itchome exit,Gate A8 is the nearest to the hotel),Kabuki Theater(15min walk),TzukijiMarket (20min walk,same direction as Theater),Ginza shopping district(5min walk),convenience stores of Family Mart,Sunkus,Lawson(just seconds away).Taxis abound on the streets...There are walking distance small Japanese restos...must try is the Ramen vending machine restaurant.Sandwiches and cold pasta salads in Family Mart are good alternstives if you are too tired to look for a resto to eat...HOTEL SERVICE/STAFF:English speaking staff in the Reception,Reservations,Breakfast Area,Housekeeping gave good service during our stay.their hospitality,patienceand willingness to help only showed excellent Japanese hospitality.Breakfast was very adequate with the choice of Japanese and Western dishes.When bedroom temp is warm,you can always request for windows to be slightly opened for fresh cool air to come in.Rooms and bathrooms were very clean everyday!MY SUGGESTIONS to Hotel:1.provide a soft pillow together with firm pillow in the beds2.change top tablecloth daily in the breakfast area.TIPS for Hotel Guests:-stay in high floor,its quieter and WIFI service is great.-upon arrival in Narita airport,takeNEX train to Tokyo Station (for non japanese,you can get roundtrip ticket for Y4000 in JR line office in basement floor of Tokyo station).In Tokyo station,follow central signs till you see Yaesu South Exit>go outside and line up for Taxi ride to Hotel,Y730 only.Best to take 5min taxi because of your luggage,it would be more convenient n less hassle for for just a few dollars.-for directions to tour sites,ask Reception on what train station to take but get detailed instructions with Train Conductor(in blue uniform and cap inside train stations)Yes,i would definitely recommend this centrally located boutique hotel in Ginza to relatives and friends!Will i stay again in Hotel Monterey Ginza on my next Tokyo trip?DEFINITELY!!MAHPhilippines

The Monterey in Ginza is ideally located for visiting Tokyo. Walking distance to all the major attractions.The staff however helpful have very limited english. As we found out Ginza is the most expensive real estate in the world.....apparently and therefore our standard size room is so tiny it is unbelievable by our standards.I would stay again but upgrade to a larger room.Also the pillows were the equivalent of a bag of rice, extremely uncomfortable but you do get used to them.The idea of being in Tokyo is not to stay in your hotel room so overall it served the purpose of our stay.

Elegant service, reasonably-sized rooms that were tatty by Japanese standards and the most appalling wi-fi. There are several similarly-priced competitors of newer vintage very close by, including a Mercure one block away and a Daiwa Roynet right next door. There are no in-hotel amenities other than an expensive restaurant for breakfast. Several Starbucks and Doutors are available in the surrounding back streets. Excellent location of course with several metro stops and the Yamanote line within a short walk. Ginza high street is just 100m away. Until they renovate and replace the Wi-fi router I’ll be trying one of the neighbours instead.

review_body: I returned to Hotel Monterey Ginza after previous stay in 2014 -- mainly because I like to stay in the Ginza area. I wanted to try the Mercure next door but it was over-priced so I returned to Monterey Ginza. This time I felt my room was smaller even though price has shot up. The double bed was too tight for two people, and there was barely any room for our luggage. We had nowhere else to sit except on the bed. The bed was not too comfortable and was low. While I did not like the room, I enjoyed the breakfast at this hotel. It had a good spread of Japanese food which was quickly replenished. There were lots of guests so the banquet hall spilled into 2 rooms.

We went to Karuizawa for my six year old boy to learn skiiing. On the trian ride back, he developed a fever, so we were stuck in the room in this hotel for the entire four days in Tokyo.Lesson No. 1: The hotel is a quiet, relaxing place to just lie in bed and do nothing.Lesson No. 2: The hotel is in a very convenient location, just two minutes from the nearest entrance to Ginza Station. It rained lightly on the day we left, and we could get to Narita Airport almost without getting wet. (Walk into Ginza Station at its east end, all the way across to its west end, and emerge next to Yarakucho Station.)Lesson No. 3: You can do Tokyo really cheap if you do take-out and local ramen all the time. There is a pretty good curry pork chop restaurant (Yabaton Tokyo Ginza), an rice with roast eel restaurant (ひょうたん屋), a local ramen restaurant (next to the eel place), and others, within a two minute walk from the hotel.Lesson No. 4: There is a drug store within five minutes' walk.Lesson No. 5: Itoya (fountain pen and stationary store) is within a five-minute walk. Evil place. Avoid if you don't want to end up buying any fountain pens.Wifi speed is quite decent. There are paid movies on TV, and you have to go out into the hallway to buy a pass (with passcode on it) to buy each movie (at 1000 yen each). We watched a few.

After a long travel day, it was a great relief to have such an easy trip from Narita airport to the hotel. We took the Narita Express to Tokyo station and rather than messing around to figure out the subway lines at night with our luggage, simply took a quick cab ride to the hotel. Check in was quick- no concerns. Service in general was good although we did not need their assistance too much. One night, we had asked them if they could help us make a reservation at a restaurant for dinner. They didn't do it, but we just went to the restaurant and made the reservation ourselves so no harm done.The location is perfect. Subway stops are close by and we never had to arrange for a cab ahead of time since there was always someone parked around the corner (i.e. at 0400 in the morning for a ride to Tsukiji market!). It was also really nice that at the end of a busy day (and night), that we could go back to the quiet and calm of Ginza. You feel a bit out of the action when you leave an area like Shibuya or Shinjuku, but we like it that way :) There is a lot of shopping around and many restaurants and bars, both modern and traditional, expensive and economical, to keep one busy for a very long time!We didn't go for the breakfast at the hotel, but its not hard to find a coffee shop or restaurant where ever you plan on being in the morning.The hotel room itself is nothing to be excited about, but it is clean and very quiet. The high ceilings are nice and distracts from the weathered looking floor. Again, nothing to be excited about, but does offer exactly what you need (clean bathroom, great amenities, small fridge, pyjamas, comfortable bed...)We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the hotel and neighbourhood!

The Hotel Monterey Ginza has an excellent location, friendly staff, great wifi, clean and spacious (for Tokyo) rooms. 1. The location of this hotel is ideal as it is in the center of everything, it is right next to a subway station (Ginza-Itchome station) and is in the heart of Ginza. In addition, it is a 5 minute walk from Misukoshi- a popular department and food store in Ginza. It is also nearby many convenience stores (as in 7/11s and Family Marts) and restaurants. When staying in Tokyo and looking for good location, this is the place. 2. The staff at the hotel was very kind to us and immediately helped us with every need. 3. The rooms were large for rooms in Tokyo, and the beds were very comfortable. There was also an in room refrigerator in case you need to store food or drinks. They had a very little amount of English channels, however, they had a large English/American movie selections. The wifi in the room was excellent and I never did not have signal. But, my major complaint is breakfast. I thought breakfast was going to be huge and have variety. I was greatly mistaken. I am vegetarian , but the lack of variety really disturbed me. The breakfast is mainly Japanese style and had some breads and egg omelet station. Be aware, these are Japanese egg omelets so they taste different. This breakfast is not meant for westerners. If you really want to dive into what a Japanese breakfast is like, than it is ideal. Additionally, the staff at breakfast took a very long time to replenish food. Bottom line: I do not recommend going to this breakfast. There are many other hotels close by and you can get a better breakfast for a lower price. For example, the Courtyard Marriott Ginza has an unbelievable breakfast with a lot of variety and is cheaper than the Hotel Monterey Ginza breakfast. Another complaint is that because it is a smaller hotel, many tours do not pick up from the hotel. So you may have to go to a larger hotel nearby where tours can pick you up. The staff, however, are very helpful in arranging tours and transportation. I would recommend staying at this hotel if location is the most important to you. It has an ideal location in the Ginza district and you can connect from the subway close by to anywhere in Tokyo(since Tokyo Metro system is very advanced). If you want to sacrifice a good breakfast, and a larger type of hotel, than this hotel is really for you. For my purposes, I had a perfect Tokyo stay.

New York City, New York

review_body: We had only one night and a day in Tokyo and were recommended to stay in Ginza. Hotel Monterey Ginza was very well located and we walked there with our luggage from the train station. Many and variously priced restaurants in area, wonderful department and other stores in Ginza. Designer stores abound, but we only needed dept store for gift shopping. Food court in the dept store was AMAZING AND WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND. we bought lunch and took it out on to street where we sat at table in middle and had an unusual picnic! For our first time in Tokyo our stay was a great success being located at this hotel and they happily stored our luggage for the day. Room clean, great little 'Japanese soak bath' , mattress good.

I have stayed at this hotel on 4 occasions, so you can appreciate I rally like it.Very clean and has everything you would expect.Rooms are small but this is fairly common in Tokyo.Service is excellent and staff have an ok level of English.The breakfast is superb and a combination of European and Japanese. I encourage you to try some of the Japanese foods.The key for this hotel is its excellent location right in the heart of Ginza and an easy 5 minutes to entry A13 of Ginza station and a 10 minute walk to Tokyo Station.The Hotel has a charming french theme and is delightfully quaint.

This hotel is in the heart of Ginza shopping district, therefore it is great to walk around all day and still have the option to head back to hotel for a rest. The room was clean and decent size. There's also convenient store around which is helpful.

We stayed 2 nights here while in Tokyo. The room was small, but not as small as I had expected based on other reviews of hotels in Japan. Service was good, and the room was clean. The location was good for what we wanted, good access but quiet enough at night. It was a bit tough to find food nearby on our first, early, jet-lagged morning, but we found a small soba place before too long.

The first think you notice about the The Hotel Monterey in Ginza is it's fantastic location and attractive facade. Almost french provincial one could say.Unfortunately the reception staff were quite unwelcoming, with very poor english and the list of do's and dont's came across more like some 1960's physical fitness camp than a pleasant hotel in one of the worlds great cities.That aside, the rooms are clean, spacious by Japan standards and quiet. The french provincial theme seems to run through the hotel decor. Breakfast was both Japanese and western and was quite adequate despite the dirty tablecloths and rather inattentive staff.The front of house staff refused to make a dinner reservation for me and my family one night and also refused to issue a spare key to my wife when she wanted to go out shopping - bazaar!In summary, great location, comfortable hotel, just don't expect to be made to feel special or welcome.

We returned to this hotel after a stay in 2009. It's in a great location with metro access nearby. The hotel is clean, quiet & as expected, on the small side. Fabulous restaurants/eateries are close by which are extremely reasonably priced. Pyjamas are supplied as are all bathroom amenities which is an added bonus for keeping laundry needing to be done to a minimum. Would highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is in a great location for Ginza. It's easy walking access to shopping and yet off the main strip a little bit so you're not overwhelmed by the people. We booked this room because we wanted to be in the Chuo area for the Tsukiji market. Luck was not on our side and it was sold out by 3:45 am when we arrived. The market will probably have moved by the time you book your room with this hotel so don't take that into consideration.Hotel concierges can speak passable English, sell Tokyo subway passes, and are generally helpful.A few downsides are the elevator and smoking. The elevators are small and shared with a restaurant they have on the second floor. You may have to wait multiple rounds for the elevator. The first room they gave us was non-smoking, but definitely had a smoking smell. The rooms do not have windows that open, so definitely ask for a room change.

I stayed at Hotel Monterey Ginza with my partner for 4 nights. I can't say enough good things about this place. Very centrally located in Ginza, it's still on a fairly quiet street and within walking distance of 3 or 4 different metro stations (Ginza, Ginza-Itchome, Higashi-ginza). There are a lot of drug stores around too, so if you need snacks, toiletries, etc. it's all within very close walking distance. The service at the hotel is excellent too. We had 2 lamps that stopped working and they immediately moved us to a bigger room as an apology (even though we said we didn't mind). I left a towel back in the old room, and it was returned to us cleaned and folded. And the mini-bar in the room was probably the most affordable mini-bar I've seen at any hotel, period. I had read the rooms are really small but I didn't think so - certainly not that much smaller than European counterparts. Highly recommended. Great value for the price, excellent service, cleanliness and location. We'd love to stay there again if we go back to Tokyo.

This hotel is within 5 minutes walking distance to the heart of Ginza and all the shopping possibilities of department stores, unique boutiques, as well as high-end stores. Many restaurants nearby, as is the Bulgari Cafe. A few steps away is the entrance to the metro station. Quality of beds are good, and breakfast is acceptable with good service. The hotel has underground parking facilities at a charge which can be convenient if you are driving into town.

This hotel is more like a bed and breakfast rather than a hotel. The lobby is very small, not what I expected for a hotel lobby to look like. From there I was hoping the rooms would not be small as well. But to my disappointment, the rooms were tiny small! Very hard to move in the room, 2 adults will not be able to walk around the room. There was no hotel safe/vault either. And the worst is there was no AC!!! The tv had no cable as well. So, I can't recommend anyone to stay in this hotel unless you get the rooms free.

Stayed for 4 nights. It's a good no frills 3 star hotel and relatively good value for Tokyo. The reception is drab and nowhere to sit but the staff were helpful. This is a strictly self service hotel, take your own luggage and find your room. I had a room on 4th floor which was immaculately clean and more than adequate for one person. The bed was perfect for me as I like a good hard mattress but may not be to everyone's taste. Would I stay here again,may be. Not because there was anything really wrong but to try something else. Overall good value for money and don't expect the frills.

I went on a whirlwind two-night trip to Tokyo over Thanksgiving 2015. I chose the Hotel Monterey Ginza based on a friend's recommendation. The location is very convenient – it's right in Ginza, easy to find, and close to multiple metros (a short walk from where the Limousine Bus drops you off, Ginza Station, and an even shorter jaunt to the red line, which takes you right to Haneda. Just remember to enter in front of the Kabuki Theater to take advantage of the escalators if you have bags!). The room was clean, with just the essentials. Nice soaking tub, small sink, Toto Washlet toilet, sealed toiletries. PJs and slippers for use. Hot water kettle. All the essentials for crashing at night. Rooms are indeed quiet, too! And solid wi-fi on my top floor room. They also let me stash my luggage on my 3rd day (for the whole day) without any issue (of course), but they also posed no judgement when I had to repack my day's shopping into my suitcase in the lobby. For that, I'm so grateful.

The Hotel has a great location near the Ginza district with metro access to all parts of the city. However, having endured a 12 hour flight and 90 min transfer to the Hotel, to find that our luggage had to be piled up in the very small reception area and the was no access to the room for 3 hours and no offer of a lounge of facilities to freshen up was very disappointing. The hotel is basically good and the food was fine but better service for long haul travellers is a sad omission.

Booking through the Hotel website was easy. They were able to grant our request of adjacent rooms or rooms near each other. Check in was smooth and fast. Front desk staff are friendly and speak good English. Not a crowded Hotel and it is off the main street of Ginza but strategically located. Tokyo station is a 15 minute walk, and the local train stations are nearer, within walking distance. A Family Mart and Lawson's just across the hotel. Lots of restaurants all over around the area. A few blocks to shopping and department stores like Matsuya with a great food court and open air roof top area to eat. The rooms are cozy and a bit too warm as the aircon temp is centralized and cannot be adjusted in the room. Had to open a window on my last night. Amenities and water are provided. Pyjamas are also available.Hotel is recommendable, and we will return for sure. I only hope the issue of the warm room temperature is addressed.

Stayed here for one night. It is conveniently accessed from Haneda airport, but be careful - there's a Hotel Monterey La Soeur in the same area, and we went there by mistake! Not to worry, it's a short walk to the correct hotel :)Check-in was swift and friendly. We were given a slightly bigger room than we'd booked. I felt the room was very spacious, though guests unaccustomed to travelling in Japan may need to adjust their expectations. The bed was very comfortable but I'm really not fond of rice-filled pillows. Bathroom had all the amenities you could require, and complimentary bottled water is supplied.The best thing for me is the location - right in the middle of Ginza, but sufficiently away from the shopping area to not be inundated with tourists. Lots of excellent restaurants around, too.I speak Japanese so cannot comment on staff ability to communicate in English. Didn't dine in the hotel so also can't comment.I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

We stayed here for one night as it was close to Tokyo Station where we will be going on the Shinkansen the following day. Location of this hotel is great, it is close to main shopping district of Ginza and also close to a subway. The hotel room was very small, we had 2 single beds and we were surprised to see how small it was. But this is Tokyo and pretty much most hotels are of similar size. Check in staff was friendly and the process was smooth and efficient. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers. Main points of this hotel is the fair price and also a great location which is close to the main areas of Ginza.

This is walking distance to the subway, a great location for shopping and restaurants. We flew into Tokyo very early in the morning and the staff were helpful in holding our luggage for the day. Check in was at 3pm, which we felt was abit late after travelling for over 10 hours but there was so much to do in the area. Staff are always helpful. Your only given 1 key per room. Room was a decent size with daily bottles of water, double bed, room WiFi, TV and bathroom. TV was quite small for the room and all channels are in Japanese, no English channels but your too busy exploring Tokyo. We were happy with the accommodation and the location, it's very central to the subways. Tip: when using subways get a suica card, extremely handy

Room is not big, clean and comfort. The lobby is small. They provide pajamas, free wifi. Staff are nice and helpful. Location near train station, shops and restaurants. You just walk and get everything you need.

It is centrally located in Ginza. a ten minute walk to the main shopping avenue. The Tsukiji market is nearby too. Restaurants, pubs and convenience stores are just steps away. The room is a modest 20 square meter area but everything works well in the room and the bathroom. Very clean and orderly. The hotel is a bit dated. We stayed in a corner room on the 12th floor. Very quiet .You won't hear noise from the corridor or the street. Free wifi is included. There is no room service but they have a breakfast area (Western and Japanese) on the lower floor. They provide you with free bottled water daily. They also don't have a concierge desk to handle restaurant reservations. It is a hotel worth visiting again considering its value for money as well as the kind and attentive staff. We stayed here for 4 nights. Party of 9.

I am biased, because my airline lost my luggage and arriving to a hotel that provides pajamas was just heavenly.Rooms are well equipped and clean, toiletries as usual in Japanese hotels are assorted and more than enough. There are water boilers and complimentary tea.The location cannot be better right in the Ginza area nearby every restaurant, shop and convenient store, with several Subway and JR stations nearby, you can walk to the imperial Palace if you want as well as to the Ginza corridor, a street full of restaurants.

Nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff. Amazing location! Walk two minutes and you're on the large boulevards full of fancy shops and malls. You can walk to the Tsukiji fish market in maybe 30 mins. The area south/south west of Ginza is dotted with bars and little restaurants and is great for walking around and experiencing city life. There is a subway station right next to the hotel and they sell 1-, 2- and 3-day-passes to the subway (both Toei and Tokyo metro lines) in the hotel reception. There is also a railway station 8-10 mins walking distance away, great for when you're off to see the rest of Japan on the Shinkansen! :)

Recently I traveled to Japan as a tourist for the first time. I wanted a Hotel in Tokyo that was moderately priced, in a good location, clean and not exorbitant in cost. The Hotel Monterey Ginza was the perfect place. It was well located in the Ginza district on a quiet street near a subway. It was just a short jog from the Imperial Gardens for morning run. There were several casual restaurants near by (and one of the greatest Ramen restaurants I experienced). The staff was professional and the price was very fair. I would recommend this hotel enthusiastically.

Wife and I stayed here for 5 days in Nov 2015.Great location, clean hotel although a little dated.Rooms are on the smaller side, but that's Tokyo!Breakfast is more then adequate.Would stay here again.

Excellently placed for most things (right next to a subway station, close to Tokyo Station, just off Ginza's main shopping street, 10 mins from the Imperial Palace Gardens, etc). Room was nice, bed comfortable, bathroom fine with good shower. And not very expensive, to boot!

I loved this hotel for its location! You are really close to many Tokyo attractions: fish market, emperor castle. It is close to several subway lines and Tokyo station. It is also steps away to a street with major department and brand stores. We were there with the friends and called the street - Fifth Avenue. There are lots of restaurants and bars as well. The hotel itself is very clean. The rooms are small like any others in Tokyo.

New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is well located. Close to ginza, fish market, emperor castle. Lots of restaurants all around including traditional Japanese and other foods - Chinese, Indian, western etc. staff were very courteous although very very busy. It is a popular hotel for tourists. Laundry service is available.

Clean tidy room in the heart of Ginza.Great location - 10 - 15mins walk to Tokyo Station and about 5 mins walk to the subway train station.Family Mart shop right outside hotel - great place to get nibbles :)

Good location with just 5-6 mins walk to JR 有樂町 station and Metro station exit is just at doorway, it is easy to travel to anywhere in Tokyo. If you take Nirita Express from airport to Tokyo station, you can take taxi to hotel, which only cost around 800-1000 yens. There are so many restaurants, cafes and convenience stores nearby, also located in shopping area, you can easily spend whole day around the hotel.We stayed in Twin room, it is tidy, clean and roomy. Bed is soft and comfortable. Bathing water is hot enough to have a good relaxation.Staff are quiet helpful. The hotel building is a nice western classic appearance.

Hotel Monterey is strategically located in a small street adjacent to the main thoroughfare of major shopping district where you can find high end name brands fashion stores. It's a corner building, that takes up a block on both sides. Built in western architecture, this hotel gives classic appearance with the marble blocks and high rise windows. The hotel sign and name is vertically written and attached to the side of the building, it is hard to find it at night since sign is not illuminated. The room we stayed is a twin beds room, feel very roomy inside. The interior decors seemed to me a bit outdated and lobby check-in area is also small and simple. Free wifi through out the hotel. Hotel clerks are courteous and communicate well in English.There are restaurants, cafes and convenience stores nearby if you don't plan to eat in the hotel restaurant. Metro Yurakucho line exit/entrance is nearby the corner, but if you want to catch the Metro Ginza line you would need to walk to the main street about 250 meters away, a blue "m" sign is easy to spot for metro entrance. In my opinion Ginza metro line stop is an easier connection point to other attractions than the Yurakucho line. Hotel is very closed to the Tokyo station, if you carry large suitcase and have travel companions, taxi ride is around 800 yens from JR Shinkansen Yaseu exit/entrance. We booked this hotel with a flash sales and $20 mobile coupon from Travelocity, we got a good bargain price for 2 nights, considering it's in a prime location of Tokyo.

We were looking for a hotel close to the main Tokyo JR rail station and in the Ginza (business) district. The Monterey Ginza was easy to find - exit the station using the South Yaseu exit and walk straight on for c 400m until you see Cafe de Ginza on the left side of the road. Turn left into Ginza Yanagi Dori and the hotel is c200m on your right. Took about 10 minutes.It's also right next to the metro line stop - Ginza Itchome, exit 13. You soon learn that the stations are so large that finding the right exit is essential without long walks!We chose a twin room based on room size and ended up on the top Floor 13 with a good view. Room very good - simple but functional and everything worked well. Used the safe at the front desk and borrowed the iron as required, both without charge. Tea/coffee facilities in the room.Buffet Breakfast excellent - omelette freshly cooked, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, rolls, yoghurt, cereal, etc and a full Japanese breakfast if preferred.Great location and staff very friendly with reasonable English. For the price, an excellent choice!The MmMoMMontere

We booked 2 nites in September and came back to the hotel 4 days later. The hotel kept our luggage for us, when we were out of Tokyo and when we came back, the luggage were already in the room! What excellent service.The counter is manned 24 hours. There are convenience stores around the hotel and it is a short walk to the Yurakucho JR Station.Its a good and reasonably priced hotel if you want to be in the Ginza area.

Located in the center of posh Ginza district, this hotel offers good environment to visitors and also to the locals. Rooms are small ( understandable if concerned about the location ) but well kept, clean. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful, so I can say if you wonder around central Tokyo, this is an ideal place to stay at reasonable rate. You should not miss the breakfast which attracts the locals. Highly recommendable.

Old interesting building, very nice people at the front desk. The reception area is the worse part of the hotel and it is the first thing you see do not let it discourage you. The hallways smell to smoke and even the room although we were in a non smoking room. The beds and pillows did not smell to smoke, so we stayed in the room and had no problem with it. The bathroom was large and well equipped. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable (we had the room with the twin beds).The price of the hotel was good compared to others. Seven minutes walk to the Ginza train station, 20 minute walk to Tokyo Station.The breakfast buffet is outstanding, about $20 per person, not cheap but plentiful. It has western and oriental foods, and good coffee.Overall if I return to Tokyo I would stay here again.

I stayed here only for one night during my conference in Tokyo. The hotel itself renovate at least one time before (I guess). The reception is located at the one of the room at the first floor, not quite big but enough for 10 peoples. The room was nice, clean, and use flooring not carpet (thus, I think this make better smell). The internet working but not too fast (I mean, good for surfing, but not for skype). The shower can change the water spray (that cool!) I never see before for the business hotel level. Breakfast was combined Japanese and western style. A little complaint is about the seat that you might cannot select. Sometimes (like me) staff put me in the middle of the room surrounding with other customers. At conclusion, I would like to recommend this hotel for Tokyo traveller. As other comments mentioned, it is walking distance to the subway for Narita and Haneda airports (same line diffirent direction).

This is a very nice and convenient hotel to stay whilst in Tokyo.It is in walking distance to Ginza shopping street and close by to Tsukiji fish market, worth to make the effort and show up at dawn for a look at the day's catch. see interesting video below:https://youtu.be/H0UzEHjSBbwhttps://youtu.be/1Y_T2fcXO1U

The buffet breakfast was worth it. That was what put the icing on our stay.Our room though was a little small but the bathroom immaculate and clean. Across the street is a convenience store that is probably open 24 hours because we were able to buy munchies before turning in for the night.This is also close to the subway, many shops and Ginza strip of shops and restaurants. From here, we could also walk to Tsukiji Market.It is not fancy but they are helpful and conveniently located and affordable.
